So, there are 11 games played at the Rose Garden with an attendance of over 20,000.

4. All six games played elsewhere have an attendance of fewer than 20,000 (rows 43, 46, 47, 48, 51, and 52).

claim: portland play only 1 back - to - back set of game during this stretch , from january 4 through the 5th
resp:
1. Identify the table containing the schedule of Portland Trail Blazers games during the specified period (January 4 to January 5).
2. Examine the table to determine if there are any instances where the Blazers played two games consecutively (back-to-back) during this stretch.
3. Find the rows in the table that have consecutive dates, i.e., check for rows with the same day of the month and the next row having a date one day later.
4. In each pair of consecutive rows, verify if there is only one set where both games fall on the same date (indicating a back-to-back set) or if each game occurs on separate days.
5. If any pair of consecutive rows contains two games played on the same date, then it indicates a back-to-back set of games for the Blazers during the specified period. Otherwise, there is no such instance.
